### Solved by superkojiman and Swappage

This is kind of a Heartbleed type vulnerability. We request a string from the server and tell it how many bytes to return. If the length of the string it finds in memory matches the length we're asking, it returns that string to us. The string we request is stored in the globals variable, along with the flag, which is read from a local file called flag. 

```
0x6b7540 <globals+512>: 0x74303077      0x74303077      0x00000000      0x00000000
```

In this case, my local flag file contains the text w00tw00t. So all I had to do was send it 512 "A"s and tell it to return a length of 520 so I'd get my string, plus the flag. I didn't know the length of the flag on the server, but I played around with some numbers until I got the flag: 

```
# nc xkcd_be4bf26fcb93f9ab8aa193efaad31c3b.quals.shallweplayaga.me 1354
SERVER, ARE YOU STILL THERE? IF SO, REPLY "" (540 LETTERS)
 flag is: bl33ding h34rt5

MALFORMED REQUEST
```
